title: Lloyd Austin
added: On November 27, 2020, [[Axios (website)|Axios]] reported that Austin is under consideration by the [[Presidential transition of Joe Biden|Biden-Harris transition]] team for the role of [[United States Secretary of Defense|Secretary of Defense]] in the incoming administration<ref>{{Cite web|last=Swan|first=Hans Nichols,Jonathan|title=Joe Biden considers retired general Lloyd Austin for Pentagon chief|url=https://www.axios.com/biden-defense-secretary-lloyd-austin-1af4a702-aaf2-4e9e-9f5f-3ece6a9ff362.html|access-date=2020-11-27|website=Axios|language=en}}</ref>

title: Lloyd Austin
added: On November 27, 2020, [[Axios (website)|Axios]] reported that Austin is under consideration by the [[Presidential transition of Joe Biden|Biden-Harris transition]] team for the role of [[United States Secretary of Defense|Secretary of Defense]] in the incoming administration.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Swan|first=Hans Nichols,Jonathan|title=Joe Biden considers retired general Lloyd Austin for Pentagon chief|url=https://www.axios.com/biden-defense-secretary-lloyd-austin-1af4a702-aaf2-4e9e-9f5f-3ece6a9ff362.html|access-date=2020-11-27|website=Axios|language=en}}</ref>

title: Lloyd Austin
added: In 2016, prior to retirement as a U.S Army General commanding troops in Iraq, Afghanistan, Yemen, Syria and Saudi Arabia,<ref>{{Cite web|last=Waltham|first=Raytheon Company 870 Winter Street|last2=Ma 02451|title=Raytheon's Laser Guided Bombs 'Pave the Way' in Operation Iraqi Freedom {{!}} Raytheon|url=http://investor.raytheon.com/news-releases/news-release-details/raytheons-laser-guided-bombs-pave-way-operation-iraqi-freedom|access-date=2020-11-28|website=investor.raytheon.com|language=en}}</ref> Austin joined the board of Raytheon Technologies, a military contractor manufacturing laser guided bombs used in Iraq and Yemen.<ref>{{Cite web|title=Lloyd J Austin III|url=https://www.rtx.com/Our-Company/corporate-governance/Lloyd-J-Austin-III|access-date=2020-11-28|website=www.rtx.com|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|last=Waltham|first=Raytheon Company 870 Winter Street|last2=Ma 02451|title=Raytheon's Laser Guided Bombs 'Pave the Way' in Operation Iraqi Freedom {{!}} Raytheon|url=http://investor.raytheon.com/news-releases/news-release-details/raytheons-laser-guided-bombs-pave-way-operation-iraqi-freedom|access-date=2020-11-28|website=investor.raytheon.com|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|title=Made in America: Shrapnel in Yemen ties US bombs to civilian deaths|url=https://www.cnn.com/interactive/2018/09/world/yemen-airstrikes-intl/|access-date=2020-11-28|website=www.cnn.com}}</ref>

title: Lloyd Austin
